segments.en: 157. The Exterior and the End of Relishing

segments.pli: “Anicceyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhu rūpe aniccāti passati, sāssa hoti sammādiṭṭhi.
segments.en: “Mendicants, sights really are impermanent. A mendicant sees that they are impermanent: that’s their right view.
When relishing ends, greed ends. When greed ends, relishing ends.
When relishing and greed end, the mind is said to be well freed.

segments.pli: dhamme aniccāti passati, sāssa hoti sammādiṭṭhi.
segments.en: Thoughts really are impermanent. A mendicant sees that they are impermanent: that’s their right view.
When relishing ends, greed ends. When greed ends, relishing ends.
When relishing and greed end, the mind is said to be well freed.”
